Bitcoin sees record $10K drop as model says $93.5K may only return in 2028

Bitcoin ‡∏õ‡∏£‡∏∞‡∏™‡∏ö‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏ì‡πå‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏ï‡∏Å‡∏•‡∏á‡∏°‡∏≤‡∏Å‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà‡∏™‡∏∏‡∏î‡πÉ‡∏ô‡∏õ‡∏£‡∏∞‡∏ß‡∏±‡∏ï‡∏¥‡∏®‡∏≤‡∏™‡∏ï‡∏£‡πå‡πÉ‡∏ô‡∏£‡∏≠‡∏ö‡∏´‡∏ô‡∏∂‡πà‡∏á‡∏ß‡∏±‡∏ô ‡πÇ‡∏î‡∏¢‡∏£‡πà‡∏ß‡∏á‡∏•‡∏á‡∏°‡∏≤‡∏Å‡∏Å‡∏ß‡πà‡∏≤ $10,000 ‡πÅ‡∏•‡∏∞‡∏°‡∏µ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£ liquidate ‡∏™‡∏¥‡∏ô‡∏ó‡∏£‡∏±‡∏û‡∏¢‡πå‡∏Ñ‡∏£‡∏¥‡∏õ‡πÇ‡∏ï‡∏°‡∏π‡∏•‡∏Ñ‡πà‡∏≤ $2.6 ‡∏û‡∏±‡∏ô‡∏•‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏î‡∏≠‡∏•‡∏•‡∏≤‡∏£‡πå‡πÉ‡∏ô 24 ‡∏ä‡∏±‡πà‡∏ß‡πÇ‡∏°‡∏á ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏ï‡∏Å‡∏•‡∏á‡∏Ñ‡∏£‡∏±‡πâ‡∏á‡∏ô‡∏µ‡πâ‡πÄ‡∏´‡∏ô‡∏∑‡∏≠‡∏Å‡∏ß‡πà‡∏≤‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£ crash ‡∏™‡∏≥‡∏Ñ‡∏±‡∏ç‡πÉ‡∏ô‡∏≠‡∏î‡∏µ‡∏ï‡∏ó‡∏±‡πâ‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏ô‡∏ä‡πà‡∏ß‡∏á COVID-19 ‡πÅ‡∏•‡∏∞‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏•‡πà‡∏°‡∏™‡∏•‡∏≤‡∏¢‡∏Ç‡∏≠‡∏á FTX ‡πÇ‡∏î‡∏¢ Bitcoin spot ETFs ‡∏°‡∏µ net outflows ‡∏ñ‡∏∂‡∏á $434 ‡∏•‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏ô ‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏ï‡∏Å‡∏•‡∏á‡πÉ‡∏ô‡∏£‡∏≠‡∏ö‡∏ß‡∏±‡∏ô‡∏ô‡∏µ‡πâ‡πÄ‡∏õ‡πá‡∏ô‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà‡∏™‡∏∏‡∏î‡πÉ‡∏ô‡πÅ‡∏á‡πà‡πÄ‡∏õ‡∏≠‡∏£‡πå‡πÄ‡∏ã‡πá‡∏ô‡∏ï‡πå‡∏ô‡∏±‡∏ö‡∏ï‡∏±‡πâ‡∏á‡πÅ‡∏ï‡πà‡πÄ‡∏´‡∏ï‡∏∏‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏ì‡πå FTX ‡πÉ‡∏ô‡∏õ‡∏µ 2022 ‡∏ô‡∏±‡∏Å‡∏ß‡∏¥‡πÄ‡∏Ñ‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏∞‡∏´‡πå Rekt Capital ‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡∏î‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏ì‡πå‡∏ß‡πà‡∏≤ Bitcoin ‡∏≠‡∏≤‡∏à‡πÑ‡∏°‡πà‡∏™‡∏≤‡∏°‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏ñ‡∏Å‡∏•‡∏±‡∏ö‡∏Ç‡∏∂‡πâ‡∏ô‡πÑ‡∏õ‡πÄ‡∏´‡∏ô‡∏∑‡∏≠ $93,500 ‡πÑ‡∏î‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏µ‡∏Å‡∏à‡∏ô‡∏ñ‡∏∂‡∏á‡∏õ‡∏µ 2028 ‡πÇ‡∏î‡∏¢‡∏Ñ‡∏≤‡∏î‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏ì‡πå‡∏ß‡πà‡∏≤‡∏õ‡∏µ 2026 ‡∏à‡∏∞‡πÄ‡∏õ‡πá‡∏ô‡∏õ‡∏µ‡∏Ç‡∏≠‡∏á‡∏ï‡∏•‡∏≤‡∏î‡∏´‡∏°‡∏µ ‡∏õ‡∏µ 2027 ‡∏à‡∏∞‡πÄ‡∏õ‡πá‡∏ô‡∏õ‡∏µ‡∏Ç‡∏≠‡∏á‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏£‡∏ü‡∏∑‡πâ‡∏ô‡∏ï‡∏±‡∏ß‡∏à‡∏≤‡∏Å‡∏à‡∏∏‡∏î‡∏ï‡πà‡∏≥‡∏™‡∏∏‡∏î ‡πÅ‡∏•‡∏∞‡∏õ‡∏µ 2028 ‡∏à‡∏∞‡πÄ‡∏õ‡πá‡∏ô‡∏õ‡∏µ‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà‡πÅ‡∏ô‡∏ß‡πÇ‡∏ô‡πâ‡∏°‡∏à‡∏∞‡∏Å‡∏•‡∏±‡∏ö‡∏ï‡∏±‡∏ß

EN

Bitcoin experienced its largest single-day drop in history, falling over $10,000 and liquidating $2.6 billion in crypto positions. This unprecedented drop surpassed previous major crashes in terms of liquidations, including the COVID-19 crash and FTX collapse, with Bitcoin spot ETFs seeing $434 million in net outflows. The daily decline was the largest percentage-wise since the FTX debacle in 2022. Analyst Rekt Capital predicts it may take until 2028 for Bitcoin to return above $93,500, forecasting 2026 as a bear market year, 2027 as a bottoming out year, and 2028 as a potential trend reversal year.

Key Points

  • Bitcoin records first-ever $10,000 daily drop
  • $2.6 billion in crypto liquidations surpasses COVID and FTX crash levels
  • Analyst predicts Bitcoin may not return to $93,500 until 2028

Article

Bitcoin ( BTC ) liquidated billions of dollars going into Friday as BTC price action set bearish records. Key points: Bitcoin liquidates $2.6 billion as it sees its first red $10,000 daily candle ever. BTC price action dives further in percentage terms than on any day since the 2022 bear market. It may take until 2028 for Bitcoin to return above $93,500 again. Bitcoin seals biggest daily dollar rout in history Data from TradingView showed BTC/USD consolidating after bouncing from $59,930 ‚Äî its first trip below the $60,000 mark since October 2024. BTC/USD one-day chart. Source: Cointelegraph/TradingView Sustained selling pressure during Thursday‚Äôs US trading session eventually sparked a liquidation cascade, with $2.6 billion in crypto positions wiped out over 24 hours, per data from CoinGlass . Crypto liquidations vs. BTC/USD (screenshot). Source: CoinGlass Commenting, crypto market participants noted that the liquidation tally had surpassed both the COVID-19 crash from March 2020 and the reaction to the implosion of exchange FTX in late 2022. COVID crash: $1.2B in liquidations. FTX crash: $1.5B in liquidations. Random Thursday (today): $1.7B in liquidations. pic.twitter.com/iY1vaYCjnd ‚Äî Alex Mason üëÅ‚ñ≥ (@AlexMasonCrypto) February 5, 2026 Bitcoin price action also brought back historical bear-market records elsewhere. In percentage terms, Thursday‚Äôs daily candle was the largest daily decline since the FTX debacle ‚Äî an event that sparked the bear-market low of $15,600. BTC/USD one-day % change. Source: Joe Consorti/X ‚ÄúThe ETF holders have never experienced this kind of sell-off,‚Äù Joe Consorti, head of growth at Bitcoin equity company Horizon, responded on X , referring to institutional investors with exposure to the US spot Bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs). They saw net outflows of $434 million on Thursday, per data from UK-based investment firm Farside Investors . US spot Bitcoin ETF netflows (screenshot). Source: Farside Investors BTC/USD, meanwhile, achieved an unenviable new feat, falling by more than $10,000 in a day for the first time. ‚ÄúYesterday was the highest volume day on $BTC since August 2024,‚Äù trader Jelle added . ‚ÄúOne for the history books.‚Äù BTC price ‚Äútrend reversal,‚Äù only in 2028? In a grim outlook for Bitcoin bulls, crypto trader and analyst Rekt Capital said that it could be 2028 before a true rebound occurs. Related: Will Bitcoin rebound to $90K by March? Here‚Äôs what BTC options say Using the BTC price cycle model as a guide, including a key moving average crossover at the end of January, Rekt Capital foresees a classic bear market year for 2026. ‚ÄúLooks like it indeed is the year of the Bitcoin Bear Market,‚Äù he wrote in an X post . ‚Äú2027 will be the Bottoming Out year for BTC. And 2028 will be the Trend Reversal year where $93500 would be finally broken.‚Äù BTC/USD 12-month chart.
